title-group.article-title: THE NORM ESTIMATES FOR THE q -BERNSTEIN OPERATOR IN THE CASE q > 1

abstract.p: The q-Bernstein basis with 0 < q < 1 emerges as an extension of the Bernstein basis corresponding to a stochastic process generalizing Bernoulli trials forming a totally positive system on [0, 1]. In the case q > 1, the behavior of the q-Bernstein basic polynomials on [0, 1] combines the fast increase in magnitude with sign oscillations. This seriously complicates the study of q-Bernstein polynomials in the case of q > 1. The aim of this paper is to present norm estimates in C[0, 1] for the q-Bernstein basic polynomials and the q-Bernstein operator B n,q in the case q > 1. While for 0 < q ≤ 1, $\parallel B_{n,q} \parallel \, = \,1$ for all n ∈ ℕ, in the case q > 1, the norm $\parallel B_{n,q} \parallel $ increases rather rapidly as n → ∞. We prove here that $\parallel B_{n,q} \parallel $ ~ $C_q q^{n(n - 1)/2} /n$ , n → ∞ with $C_q \, = \,2(q^{ - 2} ;\,q^{ - 2} )_\infty /e$ . Such a fast growth of norms provides an explanation for the unpredictable behavior of g-Bernstein polynomials (q > 1) with respect to convergence.
